titleStmt.title: John T. Sebree to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9611

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B MaGoffin Govr of Kentucky
Your Petitioner John Sebree represents that at the Octr term 1860 of the Franklin Circuit Court he was fined Thirty dollars for a misdemeanor in Committing an assault upon one Hudson
He States that he Committed no injury upon the person of Hudson whatever and being poor he prays Your Excellency to remit Said fine
P. U. Major Respectfully represents to his Ex'cy that the circumstances in this case are such that it appeals strongly to executive clemency, and he accordingly recommends that said judgt be remitted

Franklin Cir. Ct
Remitted
B. M.
$30 } Misdemeanor
John Sebree
Issd Nov 13. 1860
